titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Sam Stark Scrapbook Collection, 1860-1950
titlepage.publisher:
Department of Special Collections and University Archives
Stanford University Libraries
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 2002 The Board of Trustees of Stanford University. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Stark, Samuel. Theatre scrapbook collection.,

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

did.abstract: 19th century American and British stage material: photographs of 19th and early 20th century American and British actors, Irish Theatre programs, American silent film, and film and stage personalities.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Sam Stark Scrapbook Collection. M0622. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Collection started by Stark's mother and aunt. Stark's paternal grandmother was the sister of Joseph Schurmann of Holland, a French impressario who brought Bernhardt, Duse, and Patti to the U.S. The core collection came to Stark on his mother's death in 1936, and he built on it through additional gifts and purchases.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Authority on the history of the theatre, particularly American theatre, and collector of theatre photographs and ephemera.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: 19th century American and British stage material: photographs of 19th and early 20th century American and British actors, Irish Theatre programs, American silent film, and film and stage personalities.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
